original: 4.The duration of this Venture (the “Term”) will begin on March 1, 2020 and continue in full force and effect until February 28, 2025 or as otherwise provided in this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
4. The span of this Venture (the "Venture Period") shall commence on March 1, 2020, and shall remain binding unless terminated early according to the provisions outlined within this Agreement, or else persist until March 1, 2025.

In this revised clause, the focus has been shifted from when the agreement will end (February 28, 2025) to when it may be terminated early. This allows for more flexibility and potential early termination of the agreement if necessary.

original: Business Management 7.The following managers (the “Managers”) have been appointed by the Members to manage the Venture:
ollama_generated:
Business Management 7. The management of the Venture shall be delegated to the individuals hereinafter referred to as "Appointed Managers," who have been designated by the Members for this purpose:

By making this slight adjustment, the new version of the clause slightly shifts the responsibility from the appointers (the Members) to the appointed parties (the Managers). This subtle change may indicate that the Managers now hold a more proactive role in managing the Venture, rather than simply being appointed by the Members to do so.

original: 11.The Managers will jointly decide major issues concerning the Venture. Where Managers are unable to reach agreement in deciding major issues, approval by a majority vote of the Members at a regular or special meeting will be required.
modified:
11. Major issues related to the Venture shall be individually decided by each Manager, unless otherwise specified as requiring consensus. In cases where no consensus can be reached, a simple majority vote among Managers at a duly convened meeting shall prevail, with the decision binding on all Managers.

In this revised clause, the original obligation for the managers to jointly decide major issues has been weakened by allowing individual decisions unless otherwise specified as requiring consensus. The condition of reaching an agreement between managers has been inverted, so that a majority vote is now required only when no consensus can be reached. Additionally, the responsibility for resolving disagreements among managers has been shifted to a simple majority vote.

original: Page 2 of 13 Management Duties 12.Except as otherwise specified in this agreement, the duties and obligations of the Managers in relation to the Venture will include the following:

12. Except in instances explicitly stated within this agreement, the roles and commitments of the Managers pertaining to the Venture will primarily encompass, but not be limited to, the following responsibilities:

This version of the clause slightly weakens the obligation by introducing "primarily" and "not be limited to," implying that while the Managers are responsible for the listed duties, there may be other tasks that fall outside these specific areas. This could provide more flexibility in the management roles.

Page 3 of 13 Member Responsibilities Description BorrowMoney.com, Inc.*HTML code, deployment, and maintenance of technical aspects are required, encompassing a database for medical dispatch personnel & product service as necessary, including activity information, data storage, and backup. This task is to be undertaken by three competent employees assigned by Borrowmoney.com, Inc.

JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go shall provide the initial investment of $60,000.00 USD. This funding will primarily originate from monthly government, city, state, and private awarded contracts. Additionally, JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go will receive an additional 10% of any gross revenue generated from these awarded contracts, with the exception that this percentage does not exceed the total contributions made by all parties.

original: Capital Contributions 15.Each of the Members has contributed to the capital of the Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value, as follows (the “Capital Contribution”):

original: Dissolution of the Joint Venture 36.The Venture will be dissolved and its assets liquidated in the event of any of the following:
ollama_generated:
Liquidation and Dissolution of the Joint Venture:

The Joint Venture may elect, at the mutual agreement of both parties, to be dissolved and its assets liquidated under any of the following circumstances:

This modification subtly shifts the power dynamic, allowing for the voluntary dissolution of the joint venture by mutual agreement instead of being automatically dissolved in certain specified events.

original: Valuation of Interest 39.In the absence of a written agreement setting a value, the value of the Venture will be determined based on the fair market value appraisal of all Venture assets (less liabilities) in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) by an independent accounting firm agreed to by all Members. An appraiser will be appointed within a reasonable period of the date of withdrawal or dissolution. The results of the appraisal will be binding on all Members. A withdrawing Member’s interest will be based on the proportion of their respective capital account less any outstanding liabilities a Member may have to the Venture. The intent of this section is to ensure the survival of the Venture despite the withdrawal of any individual Member.
modified: 39. Valuation of Interest: In the event that no written agreement specifies a value, the worth of the Venture shall be calculated as the estimated fair market value of its assets (excluding liabilities) based on the latest financial statements prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP), by an independent accounting firm chosen by consensus among all Members. The appointment of this appraiser will occur within a reasonable timeframe following the initiation of the withdrawal or dissolution process. The appraisal's findings shall serve as a suggestion to all Members, but it is not binding unless agreed upon by a majority vote. A departing Member's stake in the Venture will be calculated based on their respective capital account balance, less any outstanding liabilities owed to the Venture, while acknowledging that this method does not guarantee the survival of the Venture following the departure of an individual Member. Instead, it is intended to facilitate a fair and equitable division of assets among remaining Members.

original: Transfer of Member Interest 41.A Member may assign their proprietary assets and their rights in distribution interest in the Venture. Such assignment will only include that Member’s economic rights and interests and will not include any other rights of that Member nor will it include an automatic admission as a Member of the Venture or the right to exercise any management or voting interests. A Member who assigns any or all of their Venture interest to any third party will relinquish their status as Member including all management and voting rights. Assignment of Member status, under this clause, including any management and voting interests, will require the consent of all the remaining Members.
ollama_generated:
41.A. The right of a Member to transfer their proprietary assets and distribution interest in the Venture is acknowledged. However, such transfer shall pertain solely to the economic rights and interests of the assigning Member, without conferring any additional rights, management or voting privileges, or admission as a new Member. Any third party receiving an assigned Venture interest from a Member shall not thereby acquire membership status, management rights, or voting privileges. It is hereby noted that the transfer of Member status, including all associated management and voting rights, requires the unanimous consent of all remaining Members.

In essence, this clause underscores that a Member's decision to assign their interest in the Venture affects only their economic rights and interests, without bestowing any additional perks or automatically admitting the assignee as a Member. Furthermore, it specifies that the transfer of Member status necessitates the approval of all existing Members.

original: Page 8 of 13 Management Voting 42.Any management vote required will be determined such that each Manager receives one vote carrying equal weight.
modified: Page 8 of 13 Management Voting 42. For any management vote necessary, the distribution of voting power among Managers shall be proportional to their respective shares in the company, granting greater influence to those with a larger stake. Each Manager's vote will continue to hold equal significance, but the number of votes each casts will reflect their individual ownership percentage.

original: Warranties 57.All Members represent and warrant that they have all authority, licenses and permits to execute and perform this Agreement and their obligations under this Agreement and that the representative of each Member has been fully authorized to execute this Agreement.
modified:
Warranties 57a. Each Party represents and warrants that it is duly authorized, licensed, or permitted to fulfill its obligations under this Agreement, and furthermore, assures that the individual signing on behalf of each Party possesses the necessary authority to do so, executing this Agreement legally and validly.

In this revised clause, I have made a slight shift in responsibility by placing it on both parties (Party instead of Members), creating a more balanced agreement. The meaning remains similar but has been rephrased for clarity and readability.

BorrowMoney.com, inc, herein referred to as the "Lender," grants the right to borrow funds to JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go, herein referred to as the "Borrower," under the following conditions:

1. The Borrower acknowledges that it is solely responsible for the repayment of the borrowed funds, and any accrued interest or fees, in a timely manner. Any delay or failure to make these payments shall be at the Borrower's sole risk and discretion. The Lender shall not be held liable for any damages resulting from such delays or failures.

2. The Borrower represents that it has the full legal capacity, authority, and resources to enter into this loan agreement, abide by its terms, and fulfill its obligations as specified herein. Any misrepresentation of these facts shall not relieve the Borrower from its responsibilities under this agreement.

3. The Borrower acknowledges that it has had an opportunity to seek independent legal counsel prior to executing this loan agreement and understands the nature, terms, and consequences of such agreement. The Borrower agrees that it enters into this agreement voluntarily and without duress or coercion.

4. In the event of a dispute arising from this loan agreement, the parties agree to seek resolution through binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association. This clause supersedes any other provision regarding dispute resolution.

5. The Borrower is solely responsible for providing accurate and complete information regarding its financial status, business operations, and any other matters relevant to this loan agreement. Any misrepresentation or omission of material facts shall not invalidate this agreement but may result in additional penalties or remedies available to the Lender under applicable law.

6. This loan agreement constitutes the entire understanding between the parties regarding the subject matter herein and supersedes any prior oral or written agreements, representations, or understandings. Any modifications to this agreement must be in writing and signed by both parties.

7. This loan agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware, without regard to its conflict of law principles. The Borrower hereby irrevocably submits to the jurisdiction of the courts located in the State of Delaware for any actions arising out of or related to this loan agreement.

8. This loan agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument.

9. The Lender reserves the right to terminate this loan agreement immediately upon discovering any breach or violation of its terms by the Borrower. In such event, the Borrower shall be responsible for all outstanding principal, accrued interest, fees, and any other amounts owed under this agreement.

10. The Borrower acknowledges that it has read this loan agreement carefully and understands its contents. By executing below, the Borrower signifies its acceptance of these terms and conditions.
